did.unittitle: Sealtest Foods vs. Milk Drivers and Dairy Employees, Local No. 645, Arbitration Transcript

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: IBT Local no.645, Milk Drivers and Dairy Employees

did.abstract: Transcript of arbitration between Sealtest Foods, a division of the National Dairy Products Corporation, and the Milk Drivers and Dairy Employees, Local Number 645, of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters in October 1956. 6 volumes

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a transcript of arbitration between Sealtest Foods, a division of the National Dairy Products Corporation, and the Milk Drivers and Dairy Employees, Local Number 645, of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. John B. English presided over the arbitration, which took place in Rochester, New York, October and November 1956.
The dispute between the parties arose over the question, "Is the Company justified in eliminating certain wholesale routes?"
The transcript is contained in 6 volumes. It was submitted to the New York State Board of Mediation in January 1966.
